==Events==
*[[3340 BC]] &ndash; [[Eclipse#Historical record|Earliest believed record of an eclipse]].
*[[1707]] &ndash; The second [[Siege of Pensacola (1707)|Siege of Pensacola]] comes to end with the failure of the British to capture [[Pensacola, Florida]].
*[[1718]] &ndash; Swedish king [[Charles XII]] dies during a [[Siege of Fredriksten|siege of the fortress of Fredriksten]] in [[Norway]].
*[[1782]] &ndash; [[American Revolutionary War]]: [[Treaty of Paris (1783)|Treaty of Paris]] &ndash; In [[Paris]], representatives from the [[United States]] and the [[Kingdom of Great Britain]] sign preliminary peace articles (later formalized as the 1783 Treaty of Paris).
*[[1786]] &ndash; The [[Grand Duchy of Tuscany]], under [[Leopold II, Holy Roman Emperor|Pietro Leopoldo I]], becomes the first modern state to abolish the [[capital punishment|death penalty]] (later commemorated as [[Cities for Life Day]]).
*[[1803]] &ndash; In [[New Orleans, Louisiana]], [[Spain|Spanish]] representatives officially transfer the [[Louisiana Territory]] to a [[France|French]] representative. Just 20 days later, France transfers the same land to the [[United States]] as the [[Louisiana Purchase]].
*[[1804]] &ndash; The [[Democratic-Republican Party|Democratic-Republican]]-controlled [[United States Senate]] begins an [[impeachment]] trial of [[Federalist Party (United States)|Federalist]] [[Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States|Supreme Court Justice]] [[Samuel Chase]].
*[[1824]] &ndash; Ground is broken at [[Allanburg, Ontario]], for the building of the [[first Welland Canal]].
*[[1829]] &ndash; [[First Welland Canal]] opens for a trial run, 5 years to the day from the ground breaking.
*[[1853]] &ndash; [[Crimean War]]: [[Battle of Sinop]] &ndash; The [[Imperial Russian Navy]] under [[Pavel Nakhimov]] destroys the [[Military of the Ottoman Empire#Ottoman Navy|Ottoman fleet]] under Osman Pasha at [[Sinop (Turkey)|Sinop]], a sea port in northern [[Turkey]].
*[[1864]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: [[Battle of Franklin II|Battle of Franklin]] &ndash; The Confederate [[Army of Tennessee]] led by General [[John Bell Hood]] mounts a dramatically unsuccessful frontal assault on [[United States|Union]] positions commanded by [[John McAllister Schofield]] around [[Franklin, Tennessee]], with Hood losing six generals and almost a third of his troops. 
*[[1868]] &ndash; A statue of King [[Charles XII of Sweden]] is inaugurated in [[Stockholm]]'s [[Kungsträdgården]].
*[[1872]] &ndash; The [[Scotland v England (1872)|first-ever international football match]] takes place at [[Hamilton Crescent]], [[Glasgow]], between [[Scotland national football team|Scotland]] and [[England national football team|England]].
*[[1886]] &ndash; The [[Folies Bergère]] stages its first revue.
*[[1902]] &ndash; [[American Old West]]: [[Harvey Logan|Kid Curry Logan]], second-in-command of [[Butch Cassidy's Wild Bunch]] gang, is sentenced to 20 years imprisonment with hard labor.
*[[1908]] &ndash; A mine explosion in [[Marianna, Pennsylvania]], kills 154.
*[[1916]] &ndash; [[Costa Rica]] signs the [[Buenos Aires Convention]], a [[copyright]] [[treaty]].
*[[1934]] &ndash; The ''[[LNER Class A3 4472 Flying Scotsman]]'' becomes the first steam locomotive to be authenticated as reaching 100&nbsp;mph.
*[[1936]] &ndash; In [[London]], [[the Crystal Palace]] is destroyed by [[fire]].
*[[1939]] &ndash; [[Winter War]]: [[Soviet Union|Soviet]] forces cross the [[Finland|Finnish]] border in several places and bomb [[Helsinki]] and several other Finnish cities, starting the war.
*[[1940]] &ndash; [[Lucille Ball]] marries [[Desi Arnaz]] in [[Greenwich, Connecticut]].
*[[1942]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: [[Battle of Tassafaronga]]; A smaller squadron of [[Japan]]ese destroyers led by [[Raizō Tanaka]] defeats a U.S. cruiser force under [[Carleton H. Wright]].
*[[1947]] &ndash; [[1947–48 Civil War in Mandatory Palestine]] begins, leading up to the creation of the state of [[Israel]].
*[[1953]] &ndash; [[Mutesa II of Buganda|Edward Mutesa II]], the ''[[Kabaka of Buganda|kabaka]]'' (king) of [[Buganda]] is deposed and exiled to [[London]] by [[Andrew Cohen (statesman)|Sir Andrew Cohen]], Governor of [[Uganda]].
*[[1954]] &ndash; In [[Sylacauga, Alabama]], [[United States]], the [[Hodges Meteorite]] crashes through a roof and hits a woman taking an afternoon nap in the only documented case of a [[human]] being hit by a rock from space.
*[[1966]] &ndash; [[Barbados]] becomes independent from the [[United Kingdom]].
*[[1967]] &ndash; The [[People's Democratic Republic of Yemen]] becomes independent from the United Kingdom.
*  1967   &ndash; The [[Pakistan Peoples Party]] is founded by [[Zulfikar Ali Bhutto]], who becomes its first chairman.
*[[1971]] &ndash; [[Pahlavi dynasty|Iran]] seizes the [[Greater and Lesser Tunbs]] from the [[United Arab Emirates]].
*[[1972]] &ndash; [[Vietnam War]]: [[White House]] Press Secretary [[Ron Ziegler]] tells the press that there will be no more public announcements concerning [[United States|American]] troop withdrawals from [[Vietnam]] due to the fact that troop levels are now down to 27,000.
*[[1981]] &ndash; [[Cold War]]: In [[Geneva]], representatives from the [[United States]] and the [[Soviet Union]] begin to negotiate intermediate-range [[nuclear weapon]] reductions in [[Europe]]. (The meetings end inconclusively on December 17.)
*[[1982]] &ndash; [[Michael Jackson]]'s second solo album, ''[[Thriller (Michael Jackson album)|Thriller]]'' is released worldwide. It will become the [[List of best-selling albums|best-selling record album in history]].
*[[1989]] &ndash; [[Deutsche Bank]] board member [[Alfred Herrhausen]] is killed by a [[Red Army Faction]] terrorist bomb.
*[[1993]] &ndash; American [[National Football League]] awards 30th franchise to the [[Jacksonville Jaguars]].
*  1993   &ndash; [[President of the United States|U.S. President]] [[Bill Clinton]] signs the [[Brady Handgun Violence Prevention Act]] (the Brady Bill) into law.
*[[1994]] &ndash; ''[[MS Achille Lauro]]'' catches fire off the coast of Somalia.
*[[1995]] &ndash; Official end of [[Gulf War|Operation Desert Storm]].
*  1995   &ndash; [[President of the United States|U.S. President]] [[Bill Clinton]] visits [[Northern Ireland]] and speaks in favour of the "[[Northern Ireland peace process]]" to a huge rally at [[Belfast City Hall]]. He calls terrorists "yesterday's men".
*[[1998]] &ndash; [[Exxon]] and [[Mobil]] sign a [[United States dollar|USD]]$73.7 billion agreement to merge, thus creating [[ExxonMobil]], the world's largest company.
*[[1999]] &ndash; In [[Seattle, Washington]], [[United States]], demonstrations against a [[WTO Ministerial Conference of 1999 protest activity|World Trade Organization meeting]] by [[anti-globalization movement|anti-globalization protesters]] catch police unprepared and force the cancellation of opening ceremonies.
*  1999   &ndash; [[British Aerospace]] and [[Marconi Electronic Systems]] merge to form [[BAE Systems]], [[Europe]]'s largest defense contractor and the fourth largest aerospace firm in the world.
*[[2001]] &ndash; In [[Renton, Washington]], United States, [[Gary Ridgway]] (aka The Green River Killer) is arrested.
*[[2004]] &ndash; Longtime ''[[Jeopardy!]]'' champion [[Ken Jennings]] of [[Salt Lake City, Utah]], finally loses, leaving him with {{US$|2,520,700}}, television's biggest [[game show]] winnings.
*  2004   &ndash; [[Lion Air Flight 538]] crash lands in [[Surakarta]], [[Central Java]], [[Indonesia]], killing 26.
*[[2005]] &ndash; [[John Sentamu]] becomes the first black archbishop in the [[Church of England]] with his enthronement as the 97th [[Archbishop of York]].
*[[2012]] &ndash; An [[Ilyushin Il-76]] cargo plane belonging to [[Aéro-Service]], [[2012 Aéro-Service Ilyushin Il-76T crash|crashes into houses]] near [[Maya-Maya Airport]] during a thunderstorm, killing at least 32 people.
